docs.lead_paragraph: Remember liquor cabinets? I haven't seen one in years, but my parents had one in the living room of our suburban home. And during my entire childhood, until I left for college, the bottles that didn't fit in that cabinet were kept in, of all places, my bedroom closet.

headline.main: Teaching Kids About Alcohol — and More

docs.abstract: When if comes to teaching children to grow up responsibly, the way a parent lives is sometimes more important than the rules they set.
docs.snippet: When if comes to teaching children to grow up responsibly, the way a parent lives is sometimes more important than the rules they set.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Danish study found “no convincing association” with the cancer, though researchers said they would continue to follow their subjects to see if risk increased with age.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since we did a Room for Debate forum on the California woman who gave birth to octuplets on Jan. 27, we have learned that she is an unemployed single mother with six other children and that she lives with her parents.
docs.abstract: Why regulating fertility treatment is bad but mandating psychological counseling is good.
docs.snippet: Why regulating fertility treatment is bad but mandating psychological counseling is good.

docs.lead_paragraph: After years of infertility, novelist M. Sindy Felin became pregnant with triplets. Since then, she says, "our little circus show runs on equal parts prayer, laughter and blissful denial." She also finds that others see her as an expert on multiples of any number, and, as she writes in a guest blog today, while she does have a lot to say, it is not necessarily what everyone else expects to hear.
docs.abstract: Guest blogger M. Sindy Felin talks about why having more than one child at a time doesn't make one an expert on the subject.
docs.snippet: Guest blogger M. Sindy Felin talks about why having more than one child at a time doesn't make one an expert on the subject.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a week after Nadya Suleman gave birth to octuplets, a national discussion has begun over whether her situation represents a cuddly family a-bloom or medical science run amok.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods, the No. 1-ranked player in the world, has been out since he had surgery after his U.S. Open playoff victory in June, and the tour has suffered in his absence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The octuplets born to an enigmatic California woman have all been alive for one week today, making them the longest surviving set of octuplets known to have been born in the United States.
docs.abstract: What was initially hailed last as a medical miracle is now looking more like a medical mystery, clouded by questions and criticism. For instance, why was Nadya Suleman, a 33-year-old single mother who already had six children --including twins -- implanted with multiple embryos? And at what clinic, in what country?

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers have discovered that a mother’s cells slip across the placenta, enter the fetus’s body and teach it to treat these cells as its own.

headline.main: Transfer of Mother’s Cells Molds Baby’s Immunity
